messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: REPORT: 340-0958-B DATE: 9/18/23  On the evening of SepTemBeR 17, PATroL offiCEr J. R. Taylor was dispatched to 1452 Elm Street in response to a reported disturbance. WiTnesses Mr. Garcia, local shop owner, and Ms. Winters, a teacher, called in the complaint. FORWARD TO: PATROL DIVISI0N. WITNESS REPORTS. Sgt. U. V. Wallace - PATROL  Patrol Officer Taylor arrived on site at approximately 20:45 and made initial contact with the complainants. It was at this time that DePUTY Z. Y. Harper joined the response for additional support. REPORT SUBMITTED TO: SGT. WALLACE, PATROL.  Winters reported hearing loud noises, akin to screaming, and then saw a shadowy figure exit the alley near Garcia's shop. Garcia corroborated this statement, adding that he heard glass breaking. Patrol Officer S. T. Upton was brought in to interview the witnesses further.  Physical evidence was discovered by TeChnician Rebecca and Technician Alex, who were processing the scene. CONTINUe FORWARD TO: FORENSIC DIVISI0N. EVIDENCE COLLECTED. Evidence included broken glass from what appeared to be a bottle, a torn piece of fabric, and a discarded mask. Reports sent to Captain A. B. Collins for review.  By 21:30, Deputy Harper and Patrol Officer Upton had identified a potential suspect. Lieutenant C. D. Edwards was informed and initiated a search in the nearby neighborhoods. A person of interest was located, but the name remains withheld.  FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISI0N 2 - STATUS [CHECK TWO] Patrol Officer Taylor, Deputy Harper, Patrol Officer Upton, Sgt. Wallace, Lieutenant Edwards, Technician Rebecca, Technician Alex  INVESTIGATION DOCUMENTS:  Witness Testimonies Forensic Reports C.C.T.V Footage Audio Recordings Incident Logs (6) Photographic Evidence CONTACT COMMANDER IN CHARGE R. Johnson D.T.P.D. 340-450 R2O 9876 Garcia, JUAN ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 254-9867 PATROL OFFICER: J. R. TAYLOR ITEM: 78-9000- 202 CRIME: 20:45 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 78999 - PENDING John Doe DATE 9/19/23 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Patrol Officer J. R. Taylor  
Officer Context: On the evening of September 17, Patrol Officer J. R. Taylor was dispatched to 1452 Elm Street in response to a reported disturbance.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Sgt. U. V. Wallace  
Officer Context: FORWARD TO: PATROL DIVISION. WITNESS REPORTS. Sgt. U. V. Wallace - PATROL  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Deputy Z. Y. Harper  
Officer Context: It was at this time that Deputy Z. Y. Harper joined the response for additional support.  
Officer Role: Deputy 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer S. T. Upton  
Officer Context: Patrol Officer S. T. Upton was brought in to interview the witnesses further.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Technician Rebecca  
Officer Context: Physical evidence was discovered by Technician Rebecca and Technician Alex, who were processing the scene.  
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Technician Alex  
Officer Context: Physical evidence was discovered by Technician Rebecca and Technician Alex, who were processing the scene.  
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Captain A. B. Collins  
Officer Context: Reports sent to Captain A. B. Collins for review.  
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Lieutenant C. D. Edwards  
Officer Context: Lieutenant C. D. Edwards was informed and initiated a search in the nearby neighborhoods.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant
